ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Objective count of adverse major life events not typically violent in nature but different from standard life events due to their severity and potentially long-term consequences, such as parental divorce, failing a grade in school, etc.
Notes: Required if cai_complete=1; Higher number is more adversity.

ElementDescription: Objective count of lifetime trauma such as witnessing violence, or experiencing traumatic events, physical/sexual/emotional abuse, being injured with a weapon, etc.
Notes: Required if cai_complete=1; Higher number is more adversity.

ElementDescription: Objective count of adverse life events in the last 12 months such as exits from social field, undesirable interpersonal and financial events, etc.
Notes: Required if cai_complete=1; Higher number is more adversity.

ElementDescription: Measures subjective response to adverse events such as general stressors, employment, relationships, and interpersonal problems. Objective count of chronic stressors.
Notes: Required if cai_complete=1; Higher number is more chronic stress.
